title: Public transport for the NRL Round 17 – Melbourne Storm v Canberra Raiders: Saturday 29th June 2024
articleContent:
Public transport is your best way to enjoy NRL, as the Melbourne Storm taking on the Canberra Raiders. Extra services will help you get to and from the AAMI Park on Saturday 29 June.

The event will begin at 7:35pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station:

  • East Pakenham - leaving at 9:56pm from Platform 6

  • Frankston – leaving at 9:52pm from Platform 4

  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 9:54pm from Platform 10

  • Sandringham – leaving at 9:54pm from Platform 2

  • Ringwood – leaving at 9:58pm and 10:08pm from Platform 9

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

  • Route 246 

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Regional train

Getting to and from AAMI Park

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station
